column4: Sound doesn't work since I upgraded from Feisty. Can anybody help me resolve that?
What's your sound card? Do you know?
from lspci: 00:14.2 Audio device: ATI Technologies Inc SB450 HDA Audio (rev 01)
why would it be muted by default? And if it is muted, how do I tell?
Nothing says "muted" when I run alsamixer.
done. I know to do that.
the "master" column says 00, and has no column at all
It's not that there's a column that just has no bars in it; there is no column, period.
the next one over, PCM, has red bars
up arrow has no effect. the "chip" is Realtek ALC861
it seems to break every time there's a kernel upgrade. :-(
It worked in Dapper and then broke in Edgy, then they fixed it in Edgy but it broke in Feisty, then they fixed it but now it's broken in Gutsy.
The kernel team should just stop fuxing with the sound drivers. :-)

I'm running on the cheapest piece of crap I could buy at the time, so it would actually not be too difficult! The problem is that the kernel developers, who have dual-core ThinkPads with a gig of RAM, would cringe to boot into it.
is it possible to download the old kernel and use it?
or do I have to do a fresh Feisty install?
I should just switch to Slackware then, or what?
